moves.name: Stand LP
moves.notes: Fantastic range for a jab

extraInfo: Fantastic range for a jab
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Stand MP
moves.notes: Great poke / buffer / footsies tool in neutral with a hit confirmable Target Combo follow-up

raw.hcWinNotes: *TC only combos normally if hit confirmed within 18F
extraInfo: Great poke / buffer / footsies tool in neutral with a hit confirmable Target Combo follow-up
Active frames 1-2 have shorter range
Active frames 3-5 gain an extended foot hitbox resulting in 2F better advantage on hit or block
Foot hitbox on active frames 3-5 cannot hit crouching opponents or cross-up (behind Elena)
The initial leg hitbox that can hit crouching opponents is only active during the first 3 active frames (disappears on active frame 4-5), making it less useful as a meaty
Forces stand on Punish Counter (this enables the MP Target Combo follow-up to combo even on initially crouching opponents)
Combos into a variety of follow-ups (5MP / 2MP / 2MK) when used to Punish moves in the midrange
Hit confirmable into Super or the Target Combo extension (too delayed Target Combo cancels only combo with a Counter-hit, Punish Counter, or Drive Rush starter)
Hatson's 2nd favorite move in the game

moves.name: Stand HP
moves.notes: Forces stand on hit

extraInfo: Forces stand on hit
Further range foot hitbox cannot hit crouching opponents (shorter overall range against crouching opponents)
Strong horizontal anti-air
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)
Hit confirmable (19F) into the HP target combo
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state on Punish Counter
The brief extended leg hurtbox on frame 11 of start-up (1F before active) is strike invincible (cannot counter-poke projectiles)

moves.name: Stand LK
moves.notes: Amazing range for a light normal (furthest of Elena's light normals) but doesn't combo into LK Spin Scythe like her jabs do

extraInfo: Amazing range for a light normal (furthest of Elena's light normals) but doesn't combo into LK Spin Scythe like her jabs do
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Stand MK
moves.notes: Core combo and frametrap tool

extraInfo: Core combo and frametrap tool
+2 extra recovery frames (15F) on whiff only

moves.name: Stand HK
moves.notes: Crushes low attacks on frames 9-17

extraInfo: Crushes low attacks on frames 9-17
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state on Punish Counter
The brief extended leg hurtbox on frame 11 of start-up (1F before active) is strike invincible (cannot counter-poke projectiles)

moves.name: Crouch LP
moves.notes: Chains into crouch LP / crouch LK

extraInfo: Chains into crouch LP / crouch LK
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
Topmost hurtboxes on frames 1-6 are vulnerable only to airborne attacks (this is to discourage its use as an anti-air)

moves.name: Crouch MP
moves.notes: Combo / Poke / Buffer tool with good range

extraInfo: Combo / Poke / Buffer tool with good range
Not an ideal anti-air despite looking like one

moves.name: Crouch HP
moves.notes: Upper body (legs) are invincible to airborne strikes on frames 8-19

extraInfo: Upper body (legs) are invincible to airborne strikes on frames 8-19
Core combo and anti-air tool
Forces stand on hit (important for Rhino Horn combo routes)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)
Either hit causes an air reset when used as an anti-air (results in very little frame advantage if the first hit connects)
Special / Drive Rush cancel occurs on the second hit (even if this hit whiffs)
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage to both hits

moves.name: Crouch LK
moves.notes: Chains into crouch LP / crouch LK

extraInfo: Chains into crouch LP / crouch LK
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Crouch MK
moves.notes: +2 extra recovery frames (18F) on whiff or block

extraInfo: +2 extra recovery frames (18F) on whiff or block
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
Links into crouch LP, but is always punishable by the opponent's 4F normal at this range

moves.name: Crouch HK
moves.notes: Has some Juggle potential naturally without Drive Rush

extraInfo: Has some Juggle potential naturally without Drive Rush
Great range for a sweep but punishable by most other sweeps at max range

moves.name: Jump LP
moves.notes: Cross-up that can gain extra frame advantage with a Target Combo extension

extraInfo: Cross-up that can gain extra frame advantage with a Target Combo extension
Can be used as a fuzzy instant Overhead (except against Blanka) after a deep jump-in Heavy (or jump-in Mediums in Burnout as well)

moves.name: Jump MP
moves.notes: Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

extraInfo: Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Can follow up with a Target Combo extension for an even stronger juggle
Whiffs completely on normal-sized crouching opponents
Shifts the normal jumping hurtbox upward during start-up (helps with avoiding some attacks)

moves.name: Jump HP
moves.notes: Elena's strongest general purpose jump-in (reaches grounded opponents faster and deals all its damage in one hit unlike jump HK

extraInfo: Elena's strongest general purpose jump-in (reaches grounded opponents faster and deals all its damage in one hit unlike jump HK

moves.name: Jump LK
moves.notes: Strong hitbox priority (especially vertically downwards) that can beat or trade with many anti-air normals

extraInfo: Strong hitbox priority (especially vertically downwards) that can beat or trade with many anti-air normals
Can be used as a fuzzy instant Overhead after a deep jump-in Heavy (or jump-in Mediums in Burnout as well)

moves.name: Jump MK
moves.notes: Cross-up

extraInfo: Cross-up
Has a wide hitbox in both directions

moves.name: Jump HK
moves.notes: First hit puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

extraInfo: First hit puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Second hit causes a spiked knockdown on airborne opponents
Second hit has the furthest horizontal range on Elena's jump-ins
Overall weaker as a jump-in since only one hit will connect at most jump timings

moves.name: Trunk Slap 1
moves.notes: Mid-range poke tool with high pushback that's mostly at safe on block (except at close range against exceptionally far-reaching 4F normals) and deals a good amount of drive gauge damage on block

extraInfo: Mid-range poke tool with high pushback that's mostly at safe on block (except at close range against exceptionally far-reaching 4F normals) and deals a good amount of drive gauge damage on block
Easily hit confirmable into the Target Combo follow-up (21F hit confirm window)

moves.name: Handstand Whip 1
moves.notes: Overhead with fast start-up and decent range

extraInfo: Overhead with fast start-up and decent range
Can be hit confirmed into the Target Combo follow-up (17F hit confirm window)

moves.name: Round Arch
moves.notes: Crushes low attacks on frames 9-17 and shifts Elena's throw hurtbox backward starting on frame 5

extraInfo: Crushes low attacks on frames 9-17 and shifts Elena's throw hurtbox backward starting on frame 5
Not actually airborne despite the animation
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on Punish Counter that can only juggle into LK / MK / OD Scratch Wheel in the corner
+2 extra recovery frames (19F) on whiff only
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Slide
moves.notes: Crouching state for the entire duration of the move (can slide under attacks that don't hit Crouch) but does not low profile under fireballs

extraInfo: Crouching state for the entire duration of the move (can slide under attacks that don't hit Crouch) but does not low profile under fireballs
Half-screen slide that hits low
+4 extra recovery frames (22F) on whiff only

moves.name: Starling Beak
moves.notes: Second hit is fully cancelable while the first hit is only Super cancelable

extraInfo: Second hit is fully cancelable while the first hit is only Super cancelable
Second hit cannot hit crouching opponents
Frame advantage shown in parenthesis refers to when the second hit whiffs on a crouching opponent
Interruptible 6F gap on block between hits

moves.name: Turning Tail
moves.notes: Both the follow-up hits on HP cannot hit crouching opponents

extraInfo: Both the follow-up hits on HP cannot hit crouching opponents
How unsafe the move is on block varies depending on if the opponent stand or crouch blocks the initial stand HP
Stand block: -3 | Crouch Block after blocking the initial HP standing: -10 | Crouch blocking the initial HP and the follow-up hits: -23
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit with a much stronger juggle after Punish Counter stand HP
Follow-up hits incur 20% damage scaling penatly if used as the first hit of a combo (only occurs if you crouch block the initial HP and then get hit standing)

moves.name: Hind Kick
moves.notes: Elena's core target combo conversion on crouching opponents (stand HP and crouch MK target combos both can't hit crouching opponents)

extraInfo: Elena's core target combo conversion on crouching opponents (stand HP and crouch MK target combos both can't hit crouching opponents)
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit

moves.name: Fluttering Lark
moves.notes: Second hit is fully cancelable

extraInfo: Second hit is fully cancelable
Second hit cannot hit crouching opponents and will always whiff after blocked crouch MK (block data is only applicable if parried)
Frame advantage shown in parenthesis refers to when the second hit whiffs on a crouching opponent
+4 extra recovery frames (24F) on whiff

moves.name: Trunk Slap 2
moves.notes: Hit confirmable extension from Elena's long range f+HP that leads to a knockdown ender on hit

extraInfo: Hit confirmable extension from Elena's long range f+HP that leads to a knockdown ender on hit
Has no juggle potential on its own (does not juggle after a wall splat)

moves.name: Trunk Slap Final
moves.notes: Target Combo ender with good corner carry and knockdown advantage

extraInfo: Target Combo ender with good corner carry and knockdown advantage
Can lead to auto-timed Lynx Whirl pressure on the opponent's wakeup

moves.name: Handstand Whip 2
moves.notes: Hit confirmable Target Combo that grants a meterless knockdown from Elena's long range overhead

extraInfo: Hit confirmable Target Combo that grants a meterless knockdown from Elena's long range overhead

moves.name: Soaring Raid
moves.notes: Both hits cross-up and grant Elena +12 frame advantage combo follow-ups on hit

extraInfo: Both hits cross-up and grant Elena +12 frame advantage combo follow-ups on hit
If the opponent is crouching, Elena lands before the MK follow-up active frames come out
The MK follow-up does not connect as an air-to-air even in Forced Knockdown scenarios

moves.name: Raptor Range
moves.notes: Both hits put airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

extraInfo: Both hits put airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Cannot hit a grounded opponent

moves.name: Leg Tackle
moves.notes: Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter

extraInfo: Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter
Has a frame perfect corner throw loop against Zangief (dash + walk 2F)
Can Drive Rush with frame perfect timing for a 1-bar corner throw loop against standard characters (slightly more lenient against Marisa / Blanka / E. Honda / Zangief)

moves.name: Leg Lift Throw
moves.notes: Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter

extraInfo: Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter
Cannot get throw oki after a corner side switch (except for a frame perfect Drive Rush + Throw against Zangief)
Sets up an auto-timed Drive Rush + stand MK (+12 on hit / +8 on block)

moves.name: Drive Impact: Giraffe Neck
moves.notes: 2 hits of armor on frames 1-27

extraInfo: 2 hits of armor on frames 1-27
Damages opponents Drive Gauge on Block (1/2 bar) | Hit (1 bar) | Counter-Hit (1.25 bar) | Punish Counter (1.5 bar)
Knocks down on hit

Crumples on Punish Counter or after absorbing at least 1 attack during start-up (+21 frames before the crumple state goes airborne, followed by airborne state on frames 22-46 before they are grounded) which counts as 2 hits of damage scaling
If the armor absorbs an attack it slows the overall start-up by 1F (27F total instead of 26F)
Pushes the opponent far back on hit or block and causes a wall splat if they hit the wall
Wall Splat on block adds 20% damage penalty on the next hit
Wall splats on hit or during Burnout counts as 2 hits of damage scaling
Wall Splat puts opponent into a special juggle state where the next move juggles them even if it doesn't normally (similar juggle rules as from Drive Rush)
Does not cause wall splat if combo'd into from other moves or unblockable setups (Lock)
Puts airborne opponents into a long spinning free juggle state when hit as a Punish Counter
Regular KDA without a Wall Splat: +35 KD
Corner wall splat on HIT: +65 KD | Block: +72 HKD
KDA can vary greatly depending on how high the opponent wall splats (higher KDA the higher they wall splat)
Can clash with other Drive Impacts if they collide on the same active frame (start at exactly the same time)
Costs 1 bar of Drive Gauge
The scrub killer

moves.name: Drive Reversal: Boar Charge
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-22 (frames 1-20 when used on wake-up as a Reversal)

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-22 (frames 1-20 when used on wake-up as a Reversal)
Armor Break (blows through all armor like Drive Impact)
Can be performed during blockstun or from a successful parry (trying to Drive Reversal after the blockstun is over will result in a Drive Impact)
Can also be performed during wake-up as a Reversal, doing it this way speeds up the start-up frames by 2 frames (18F start-up instead of 20F)
Drive Reversal immediately removes the current blockstun you're in and starts the attack
Causes a 4F screen freeze that occurs after the 6th start-up frame, which can mess up the opponents input timing, or enable them to do a simple input OS to counter the Drive Reversal
Safe on block (-2) when used against an opponent currently in Burnout
Costs 2 bars of Drive Gauge

moves.name: Drive Parry
moves.notes: Parries all strikes and projectiles (high and low) from frame 1

extraInfo: Parries all strikes and projectiles (high and low) from frame 1
12F parry window (can hold the parry to extend the parry window)
Perfect Parry occurs on the first 2 active frames (cannot achieve Perfect Parry if you buffer into parry by holding it during Reversal windows; Perfect Parries have to be timed properly)
Can still hold charge directions during Parry
Can block during the recovery frames of a regular parry (can still get hit during the recovery frames if you don't block correctly)
Getting thrown or hit at any point during the recovery frames of a whiffed parry attempt results in a Punish Counter
Successfully parrying a move puts you into the same amount of blockstun as that move would regularly do on block (but a Perfect Parry has only 1F of recovery)
Throw invincible during the recovery of a successful parry (just like during blockstun)
Perfect Parrying a strike has only 1F of recovery and disables the opponent from canceling their attack (basically a guaranteed punish opportunity)

After a successful Perfect Parry, you suffer a 50% penalty to your Damage, Drive Gauge Generation, and Drive Gauge Damage on any of your following attacks when punishing the opponent (in addition, both you and the opponent suffer a 20% penalty to their Super Meter gain during this period)
Fully invincible for 6F after a successful Perfect Parry against a strike, during which period you can cancel into anything you want and it carries over the brief invincibility frames
Perfect Parrying projectiles puts you into fixed 10 frames of recovery and applies the same 50% scaling penalties (and 20% Super Meter penalty) on your following attacks when punishing the opponent
Parrying a Strike and Projectile on the same frame will result in a regular parry for the strike attack (effectively ignoring the projectile's hitstop / blockstun)
Perfect Parrying a Strike and Projectile on the same frame will give a screen freeze like you Perfect Parried a Strike, but still give you 10F recovery as if you had Perfect Parried a Projectile
Can cancel into Drive Rush during active frames 3 and onward (fastest Drive Rush method is to buffer a forward input before doing parry + forward again)
Can cancel into Drive Reversal from a successful parry (just like you can normally during blockstun)
Costs 1/2 bar Drive Gauge (continues to deplete Drive Gauge as you hold the Parry)
You lose the parry if you go into Burnout from the Drive Gauge cost
Rewards 1 bar Drive Gauge (1/2 bar total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successfully parrying a strike
Rewards 1/2 bar of Drive Gauge (0 bar total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successfully parrying a projectile
Rewards 2 bars of Drive Gauge (1.5 bars total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successful parrying a Drive Impact
Successfully parrying a strike attack splits the regular block pushback between both players (while Perfect Parrying a strike removes all of its pushback)
Successfully parrying a projectile or Drive Impact reduces the pushback of it by half (while Perfect Parrying a projectile or Drive Impact removes all of its pushback)

Your hurtbox and throw box expand slightly towards the opponent for the entire duration of the Parry (Throw box extension starts instantly on frame 1, while the Hurtbox extension starts on frame 3, after the initial 2F Perfect Parry window)
Parrying while crouching maintains a regular crouch hurtbox for the first 2 frames of the parry (during the initial Perfect Parry window)

moves.name: Drive Rush
moves.notes: Dashes forward and enhances the next normal used out of the Drive Rush with +4 extra hitstun / blockstun (some moves also get unique properties enhanced such as juggle state)

extraInfo: Dashes forward and enhances the next normal used out of the Drive Rush with +4 extra hitstun / blockstun (some moves also get unique properties enhanced such as juggle state)
The +4 bonus frame advantage gained from a Drive Rush enhanced move also stacks with any bonus frame advantage that move may have gained from Counter-Hit or Punish Counter
Cancelable into from special cancelable grounded normals

Drive Rush maintains buffers (freezes the buffer window) during it start-up and freeze frames - This allows players to do things normally not possible within the normal buffer windows, such as Drive Rushing into a charge special
The initial freeze frames that occur when a Drive Rush happens eats the opponents inputs
Framedata shown in parentheses refers to the Drive Rush version used from a Parry

Drive Rush recovery frames is only 24F total (23F if done from a Parry) - but the enhanced dash itself is 46F total (45F if done from Parry) and you can cancel it as early as frame 9 (frame 11 if done from a Parry)

You stop building any form of Drive Gauge on your attacks after using a Drive Rush in the MIDDLE of a combo (but you still continue to build drive gauge as normal if you did Drive Rush at the START of a combo)
Applies extra damage scaling penalty after using a Drive Rush in the MIDDLE of a combo (no damage scaling if you use Drive Rush at the START of a combo)
Costs 3 bars of Drive Gauge if canceled into from a move
Costs 1/2 bar of Drive Gauge if canceled into from Parry (for a total of 1 bar of Drive Gauge when you factor in the initial 1/2 bar cost of the Parry)

moves.name: Taunt
moves.notes: Framedata listed is for the down+Taunt version that deals a bit of damage (300) but is very punishable on hit or block

extraInfo: Framedata listed is for the down+Taunt version that deals a bit of damage (300) but is very punishable on hit or block
Back Taunt can transition to a handstand walk by holding forward or backward on frames 181-370

extraInfo: Airborne on frames 13-36 (crushes Low attacks on frames 15-34)
Cannot hit crouching (core combo tool in all other situations)
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
+3 extra recovery frames (19F) on block and whiff
KDA (Knockdown advantage) listed refers to hitting grounded opponents (KDA is usually slightly less when hitting airborne opponents mid-combo)

Tends to travel underneath and past airborne opponents a lot (can be used to switch sides mid-combo and still juggle into Scratch Wheel on the other side)
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
+6 extra recovery frames (19F) on block and whiff
KDA (Knockdown advantage) listed refers to hitting grounded opponents (KDA is usually slightly less when hitting airborne opponents mid-combo)

moves.notes: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-9

extraInfo: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-9
Airborne on frames 7-34 (Forced Knockdown state)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)
Launches opponent into a limited juggle state
Incurs a 30% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo (like in high hitting anti-air or juggle scenarios)

moves.name: MK Scratch Wheel
moves.notes: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-11

extraInfo: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-11
Airborne on frames 7-41 (Forced Knockdown state)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)
Launches opponent into a limited juggle state
Deals 600 less damage (600) on active frames 4-6 (first hit whiffs)
Incurs a 30% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo (like in high hitting anti-air or juggle scenarios)

moves.notes: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-12

Airborne on frames 7-46 (Forced Knockdown state)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)

Deals 900 less damage (500) on active frames 5-6 (first two hits both whiff)
Incurs a 30% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo (like in high hitting anti-air or juggle scenarios)

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-8
Airborne on frames 7-52 (Forced Knockdown state)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)

Incurs a 30% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo (like in high hitting anti-air or juggle scenarios)

moves.name: Lynx Song > Leopard Snap
moves.notes: Combo / Poke / Harassment tool that's mostly safe on block due to the pushback

extraInfo: Combo / Poke / Harassment tool that's mostly safe on block due to the pushback

Elena loses her Projectile invincibility and Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Song (Roll) immediately when she transitions into this follow-up (the other follow-ups maintain those properties for longer and are thus more suited for countering projectiles)
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
Minimum start-up varies depending on which version of Lynx Song (Roll) Elena does (LP: 13+10 | MP: 13+10 | HP: 16+10 | OD: 15+10)

moves.name: Lynx Song > Harvest Circle
moves.notes: Projectile invincible on frames 1-10 (not factoring in the Projectile invincibility frames from the prior Lynx Song roll)

extraInfo: Projectile invincible on frames 1-10 (not factoring in the Projectile invincibility frames from the prior Lynx Song roll)
Extended kick hurtbox is invincible to airborne strikes on frames 8-10 (during the active frames) to help with anti-airing
Combo / Projectile punish / Situational anti-air tool
Elena loses her Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Song (Roll) immediately when she transition into this follow-up
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
Minimum start-up varies depending on which version of Lynx Song (Roll) Elena does (LP: 16+8 | MP: 18+8 | HP: 19+8 | OD: 18+8)

Elena loses her Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Song (Roll) immediately when she transition into this follow-up (also briefly loses her Projectile invincibility before gaining it again on frame 5 of start-up)
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state on hit
Minimum start-up varies depending on which version of Lynx Song (Roll) Elena does (LP: 16+22 | MP: 18+22 | HP: 19+22 | OD: 18+22)

+1 extra recovery frames (15F) on whiff only

Elena loses her Projectile invincibility and Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) immediately when she transitions into this follow-up (the other follow-ups maintain those properties for longer and are thus more suited for countering projectiles)
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit (key combo tool in optimal / max damage combos)
Can be used after Spin Scythe to continue the pressure on hit (2F gap frametrap on hit)

moves.name: Lynx Whirl > Harvest Circle
moves.notes: Projectile invincible on frames 1-10 (not factoring in the Projectile invincibility frames from the prior Lynx Whirl roll)

extraInfo: Projectile invincible on frames 1-10 (not factoring in the Projectile invincibility frames from the prior Lynx Whirl roll)

+2 extra recovery frames (16F) on block and whiff
Combo / Projectile punish / Situational anti-air tool
Elena loses her Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) immediately when she transition into this follow-up
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
Combos from Spin Scythe > Whirl cancel on Counter-Hit / Punish Counter
The first hit pulls opponents inward on hit or block (ensures combo consistency as Elena moves backwards)

moves.name: Lynx Whirl > Mallet Smash
moves.notes: Overhead + Low & Throw Crush tool

extraInfo: Overhead + Low & Throw Crush tool
Projectile invincible on frames 5-27 (top Head hurtbox section is not Projectile invincible) - not factoring in the Projectile invincibility frames from the prior Lynx Whirl roll
Low crushes on frames 5-22
Airborne on frames 9-22 (Elena counts as Standing on the second active frame)
Can also be used for oki or to continue the pressure even on block (+3)

Elena loses her Crouch size hurtboxes from the prior Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) immediately when she transition into this follow-up (also briefly loses her Projectile invincibility before gaining it again on frame 5 of start-up)
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state on hit

moves.name: LK Spin Scythe
moves.notes: First 2 hits force stand on hit (so the last 2 hits to also combo)

extraInfo: First 2 hits force stand on hit (so the last 2 hits to also combo)
Further range foot hitbox on the first 2 hits cannot hit crouching opponents (shorter overall range against crouching opponents, which can affect whiff punishes)
Last 2 hits cannot hit crouching opponents at all
Block disadvantage shown in parenthesis (-35) refers to when the last 2 hits whiff on crouch blocking opponents
Cancelable into Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) from the 2nd hit, allowing Elena to extend her combos or to keep up the pressure / mixup the opponent
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage on the first 2 hits
Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) cancel from the 2nd hit combos into Harvest Combo (f+MK) on Counter-Hit and Leopard Snap (f+LK) on Punish Counter
Last hit puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit (first 2 hits keep them grounded)

moves.name: MK Spin Scythe
moves.notes: First 2 hits force stand on hit (so the last 2 hits to also combo)

extraInfo: First 2 hits force stand on hit (so the last 2 hits to also combo)
Further range foot hitbox on the first 2 hits cannot hit crouching opponents (shorter overall range against crouching opponents, which can affect whiff punishes)
Last 2 hits cannot hit crouching opponents at all
Block disadvantage shown in parenthesis (-37) refers to when the last 2 hits whiff on crouch blocking opponents
Cancelable into Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) from the 2nd hit, allowing Elena to extend her combos or to keep up the pressure / mixup the opponent
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage on the first 2 hits
Lynx Whirl (enhanced Roll) cancel from the 2nd hit combos into Harvest Combo (f+MK) on Counter-Hit and Leopard Snap (f+LK) on Punish Counter
Last hit puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit (first 2 hits keep them grounded)
+42 KD when hitting grounded opponents which sets up for a safe jump if close enough to the corner

moves.name: Meteor Volley
moves.notes: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-23

extraInfo: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-23
Has no strike/throw/projectile invincibility (cannot be used as a reversal)
Airborne on frames 9-65 (Forced Knockdown state)
Armor Break
Depletes 0.5 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent
Incurs 30% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
Incurs 10% immediate scaling and counts as 2 hits of damage scaling when comboed into
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)
Launches the opponent into a limited juggle state (follow-up juggles always possible)

moves.name: Revival Dance
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-17

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-17
Armor Break
Depletes 1 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent
Excellent anti-fireball tool due to its invincibility and forward movement
Slow startup makes it a risky reversal option (can be safely meatied by light normals)
On HIT only; Can hold down during the move to sacrifice damage (1950 damage instead of 2800) and oki (+1 HKD instead of +25 HKD) to instead heal yourself by 1300 HP (13% health)
This healing is unaffected by scaling and deals the same Drive damage to the opponent as the regular version

moves.name: Song of the Grasslands
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-11

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-11
Armor Break
Depletes 1.5 Drive Bars on hit for the opponent
Super cinematic time regenerates ~2.1 Drive Bars for Elena
Incurs 10% damage scaling when canceled into from Specials
Great anti-air at mid to long range, but can whiff under closer range jumps and cannot hit cross-up (behind Elena)

Armor Break
